snippet: Just such an outlook the Wizard had fromhis windows; and of course what he most wished for was to bring thesinging Tweed into his secret garden, just as you coax a lovely wildbird, if you can whistle its own notes, under the trees it loves.

title: The Heather-Moon
author: Williamson, C. N. (Charles Norris)
snippet: Such a peaceful sleep it must be with the Tweed singing out ofsight, and yews old as legend to play lullabies upon their ownharp-strings when the wind touches their dark, rustling sleeves.
